intro: Zephyranthes neumannii, commonly known as the night-blooming false onion, is a species of flowering plant in the Amaryllidaceae family. It is native to Mexico and is characterized by its showy, white to pale pink flowers that open at night. The plant produces a cluster of small, white, bell-shaped blooms, which emit a subtle fragrance. It thrives in well-drained soil and prefers full sun to partial shade. Zephyranthes neumannii is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is relatively easy to care for in warm climates.
